whatIsFinops.title: What is FinOps?: A Fundamental Guide
whatIsFinops.intro: FinOps is an evolving cloud financial management discipline and cultural practice that brings financial accountability to the variable spending model of the cloud, enabling you to get maximum business value from your cloud spending. At the heart of FinOps lies an iterative cycle known as "Inform, Optimize, Operate." To demonstrate our commitment and expertise in this field, we chose the domain www.finops.ist. FinOps.ist is Turkey's leading platform in financial operations management.
whatIsFinops.domainStatement: www.finops.ist - The digital hub of your financial operations. The only destination carrying FinOps methodology from Istanbul to the world, enhancing the financial efficiency of local and global businesses.

step1.title: 1. Inform
step1.content: This first phase is all about visibility. Teams are provided with accurate, timely, and understandable information about cloud spending. This enables them to understand where costs are coming from, who is responsible, and which business metrics they relate to. Effective tagging strategies, cost allocation reports, and dashboards are the foundational tools of this phase.

step2.title: 2. Optimize
step2.content: After achieving visibility, the optimization phase begins. This phase is not just about cutting costs; it's about increasing efficiency. Teams are empowered to shut down idle resources, perform right-sizing, and leverage discounted pricing models like AWS Savings Plans or Azure Reserved Instances. The goal is to achieve the highest value at the lowest cost without sacrificing performance.

step3.title: 3. Operate
step3.content: The operation phase aims to make FinOps practices continuous and automated. This includes setting up alerts for spending that exceeds defined budgets, establishing anomaly detection mechanisms, and automating governance policies. Teams ensure they are acting in alignment with financial goals without compromising speed and innovation.

whatIsFinops.conclusion: This cycle makes FinOps not a one-time project, but a continuous cultural practice. Companies maintain control over cloud spending by iterating through these three steps, while also preserving engineering teams' freedom to innovate. As www.finops.ist, we are here to apply this cycle most effectively to Turkish businesses and optimize your financial operations.

bringingTeams.title: Bringing Teams Together: Finance and Engineering Collaboration
bringingTeams.intro: Traditionally, finance teams focus on controlling costs while engineering teams are driven by speed and innovation. These different goals often lead to friction. FinOps solves this problem by bringing these two worlds together in a common language through the concepts of "Unit Cost" and "Shared Responsibility."

section1.title: What is Unit Cost?
section1.content: Viewing cloud costs only as total spending prevents meaningful dialogue. Instead, FinOps ties costs to business metrics. For example, instead of "total server cost," metrics like "cost per customer" or "cost per transaction" are used. This enables engineers to understand the financial impact of their technical choices, and finance teams to understand the impact of business growth on costs.

section2.title: Shared Responsibility
section2.content: FinOps removes cost management from being solely the finance department's responsibility. Instead, it creates a culture where every engineer is responsible for the cost of the service they develop. This turns cost from a "blame" tool into a "metric" that everyone tries to optimize. While finance provides central budgeting and governance, engineering teams have the authority to efficiently use and optimize their own resources.

bringingTeams.conclusion: When these two concepts come together, finance and engineering are no longer adversaries, but partners running toward the same goal, speaking the same language. The result is a cost-efficient, yet innovative and agile organization.

dataDriven.title: Making Data-Driven Decisions
dataDriven.intro: In FinOps culture, decisions are based on concrete data, not intuition or assumptions. This enables companies to both keep costs under control and plan the future more accurately. Data plays the most critical role especially in areas like anomaly detection and budget forecasting.

section1.title: Anomaly Detection
section1.content: Cloud environments are dynamic and costs can spike unexpectedly. Situations like a developer accidentally writing code that creates an infinite loop or a service suddenly consuming excessive resources can inflate cost bills. Data-driven anomaly detection systems learn normal spending patterns and immediately detect sudden increases outside this pattern, alerting relevant teams. This prevents surprise bills and increases financial predictability.

section2.title: Budget Forecasting and Capacity Planning
section2.content: Historical spending data is gold for predicting future cloud costs. FinOps teams use this data to analyze seasonal trends, growth rates, and potential costs of new projects. This not only enables creating more accurate budgets, but also facilitates capacity planning. Teams predict future resource needs in advance, knowing when and how much investment to make.

dataDriven.conclusion: Data-driven decision making transforms FinOps from a reactive cost control mechanism into a proactive strategic management discipline. Companies create more space for innovation by using their resources most efficiently.
dataDriven.imageAlt: Dashboard screen with data analysis and charts

getStarted.title: Finops AI Setup and First Steps
getStarted.intro: This guide contains all the steps you need to quickly get started with the Finops AI platform. We will cover every step from setup to creating your first dashboard in a simple and understandable way.

step1.title: 1. Setup and Project Creation
step1.content: To start using our platform, you first need to create an account and define your first project. Your project will be your central workspace housing all your data sources, dashboards, and reports.
step1.quote: With just a few clicks, you can start the data integration process by connecting your cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP) or local databases.

step2.title: 2. Security and Authorization
step2.content: Data security is our top priority. Finops AI ensures that only authorized individuals can access your sensitive data with Role-Based Access Control (RBAC). You can easily manage data and dashboard access by assigning your team members to different roles (Administrator, Editor, Viewer).
step2.caption: User roles and permission settings panel.

step3.title: 3. Make Data-Driven Decisions
step3.content: After setup is complete, it's time to make your data speak! Our platform brings together data from different departments (Finance, Sales, Marketing, Operations) to provide a 360-degree company view. This holistic perspective eliminates silos and encourages cross-team collaboration.

benefit1.title: Strategic Alignment
benefit1.description: All departments focus on common goals by working on the same data set.

benefit2.title: Efficiency Increase
benefit2.description: Save time by automating manual reporting and data collection processes.

benefit3.title: Real-Time Insights
benefit3.description: Respond instantly to market changes with dashboards equipped with real-time data.

getStarted.conclusion: Now you know the basics of the Finops AI platform. For more information, you can explore other documentation sections or get inspired by our

hero.title: Analyze Your Data with Artificial Intelligence

autoDashboard.title: Auto-Generate Dashboards

autoDashboard.feature1Desc: AI automatically selects the most suitable chart types for your data

autoDashboard.feature3Desc: Accept AI suggestions or apply your own style
autoDashboard.feature4Desc: Create as many dashboards as you want for different datasets

chat.title: Conversational Data Analysis
chat.description: Chat with your AI assistant about your data and perform deeper analysis. Get answers in minutes instead of manually sifting through mountains of data.
chat.feature1Desc: Ask questions like What was the best-selling product this month?
chat.feature2Desc: AI shows you charts, correlations, and anomalies
chat.feature3Desc: Like a conversation: How about last year?
chat.feature4Desc: Get responses in seconds instead of minutes

chartGenerator.placeholder: e.g., Show sales trend for the last 6 months as a line chart

correlations.title: Correlation, Comparison and Anomaly Detection
correlations.description: Ask AI to analyze your data and find patterns. Automatically discover hidden relationships, unexpected changes, and trends.

hero.title: One-Click Reports and Custom Dashboards

userJourneyMap.title: User Journey Map
userJourneyMap.subtitle: Strategic Steps of a Prospect's Transformation into a Customer

phase1.title: Discovery and Decision
phase1.description: The prospect first encounters our platform and understands its potential value.

step1.title: First Contact
step1.description: The prospect reaches the website through an ad, social media post, search engine result, or recommendation.

step2.title: Understanding Value Proposition
step2.description: Browses homepage, solutions, and about us pages. Evaluates the suitability of offered services to their needs.

step3.title: Reviewing Pricing
step3.description: Visits pricing page to compare offered plans (Individual, Premium, Enterprise) and their features.

step4.title: Decision Moment
step4.description: Decides to try the platform and clicks 'Sign Up' or 'Start Analysis' button.

phase2.title: Registration and Authentication
phase2.description: The prospect takes their first step into the system and their identity is verified. This is the first line of security.

step1.title: Registration Form
step1.description: User fills out the registration form by entering Full Name, Company Name, Email, and a secure password.

step2.title: Password Confirmation
step2.description: System requests password entry twice to prevent typos.

step3.title: ARMORED GATE - Email Verification
step3.description: A verification email is sent to the user's account. Until the user clicks this link, their account remains in 'Pending' status and cannot access critical functions.

step4.title: CRITICAL ASSURANCE - Password Reset Infrastructure
step4.description: If the user forgets their password, a reset link is sent to their email address via the 'Forgot Password' link.

phase3.title: Plan Selection and Payment
phase3.description: The verified user selects a plan suitable for their operational needs and completes the payment process.

step1.title: Plan Selection Screen
step1.description: The user who verified their email is redirected to the plan selection page and chooses the most suitable plan.

step2.title: OFFICIAL PROCEDURE - Digital Contract Acceptance
step2.description: Just before the payment step, the user is presented with 'Terms of Service' and 'Privacy Policy'. Checking the 'I have read and accept' box is mandatory. This action has the nature of a digital signature.

step3.title: Secure Payment Gateway
step3.description: User is redirected to a PCI-DSS certified secure payment gateway interface such as Stripe or Iyzico to enter credit card information. Bank information is NEVER stored in our system.

step4.title: Payment Confirmation and Invoicing
step4.description: After successful payment, the user is redirected back to our system. The system automatically generates an invoice and adds it to the user's panel.

phase4.title: Activation and Integration
phase4.description: Now a customer, the user activates their panel and integrates their first data into the system.

step1.title: Panel Activation
step1.description: With payment confirmation, the user's account moves to 'Active' status. All features and dashboard panels for their selected plan become accessible.

step2.title: 'WELCOME' PROTOCOL - User Onboarding
step2.description: The customer is greeted on first login with a 'Welcome' tour that guides them step by step. This tour shows how to connect their first data source or upload their first .csv/.xlsx file.

step3.title: Data Upload / Integration
step3.description: The customer uploads their first dataset or sets up integration (if available) with the help of the guide.

step4.title: First Value Generation
step4.description: Our software processes and organizes the uploaded data, producing meaningful and visual outputs on the customer's selected dashboard panel. This is when the customer concretely sees the value of what they paid for.

phase5.title: Value Generation and Expansion
phase5.description: The customer regularly uses the platform, derives value, and expands collaboration.

step1.title: Regular Usage and Reporting
step1.description: The customer regularly uses the platform to support business decisions, generates reports, and performs analyses.

step2.title: CHAIN OF COMMAND - Team Management
step2.description: (Enterprise Plan) The customer invites new users from their team with different permission levels ('View Only', etc.) to the system.

step3.title: Expansion (Upsell)
step3.description: A customer on the Individual plan upgrades to Premium when they need more features. The platform can detect this need and offer upgrade proposals.

step4.title: Loyalty and Referral (Brand Ambassadorship)
step4.description: Highly satisfied customers recommend the service to their network, leading new prospects to enter Phase 1.

notFound.title: Page Not Found
notFound.description: The page you are looking for might have been removed, had its name changed, or is temporarily unavailable.
notFound.searchTitle: Couldn't Find What You're Looking For?
notFound.searchDescription: You can search in your dashboard or contact our support team.

csvLibrary.title: CSV Library
csvLibrary.subtitle: Ready datasets for demos and sales presentations. {count} datasets available.

upload.title: Upload CSV File
upload.description: Upload your own CSV file. File must be in FinOps CSV Standard v1 format.

whatIs.title: What is Excel Smart Data Layer?
whatIs.content: A 6-step wizard system that helps you prepare, analyze, and visualize your Excel/CSV files. The process: Upload File ‚Üí Select Sheet ‚Üí Detect Header ‚Üí Map Columns ‚Üí Validate Data ‚Üí Preview & Save.

howItWorks.title: How Does It Work?
howItWorks.step1: Upload File: Drag & drop your Excel/CSV
howItWorks.step2: Select Sheet: Choose which sheet to use (for multi-sheet files)
howItWorks.step3: Header Detection: System finds header row
howItWorks.step4: Column Mapping: AI suggests column types
howItWorks.step5: Data Validation: System checks for errors
howItWorks.step6: Preview & Save: Review and save your data

examples.title: Example Scenarios
examples.sales: Sales Data: Upload monthly sales report, map columns (date, product, amount), visualize
examples.expenses: Expenses: Upload expense report, categorize (date, category, amount), analyze
examples.inventory: Inventory: Upload stock data, track (product, quantity, warehouse), optimize

security.title: Security & Privacy
security.local: Your data is stored in your browser (localStorage)
security.private: No data is sent to external servers
security.delete: You can delete your data anytime
